intro: Ciliosemina purdieana, commonly known as the Cape York hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Ciliosemina purdieana is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it resilient in its natural habitat.
